subject: Re: [junit] Failing multiple times in one test
msgSnippet: ... Both are Maps, but the notable differences are that HashMap methods are unsynchronized and nulls are allowed; Hashtable methods are synchronized and nulls
messageBody:
Laurent Duperval wrote:

> On 1 Sep, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >>I'm writing a test whose purpose is to make sure that a Hashtable contains
> > a
> >>certain set of keys. Basically, the test will make sure that someone
> > filling
> >>out a form on the web provides all the mandatory info
> >
> > Hashtable? Tsk, tsk... why aren't you using Map instead? :)
> >
>
> Uhm... What's the diff?
>

Both are Maps, but the notable differences are that HashMap methods are unsynchronized and nulls are allowed; Hashtable methods are synchronized
and nulls are not allowed.

Mike
